resources.string: Prepares the tag to use the SUN/SDM feature
Prepares the tag by creating a new application, creating a Standard File to take the NDEF Container File (CC) and a Standard File that stores the template URL (NDEF Data File).
WARNING: The app will IMMEDIATELY write to an attached tag without any further confirmation !

More Information about the application and file creations:
 1) The app will create a new application with applicationID 010000 and ISO application name D2760000850101, this is necessary for NDEF workflow. The app will have 5 AES based application keys. There are no restrictions on file and directory handling.
 2) In the new application a new Standard File is created with a size of 32 bytes that holds the NDEF Container File.
 The file number is 01 and the ISO fileId is E103h, the Communication mode is Plain, Access rights: Read & Write key: E, CAR key: E, Read key: E, Write key: E (E means free access without any authentication)
 3) A second Standard File is created in the application with a sie of 256 bytes that hold the template URL for the NDEF Link record.
 The file number is 02 and the ISO fileId is E104h, the Communication mode is Plain, Access rights: Read & Write key: E, CAR key: 0, Read key: E, Write key: E (E means free access without any authentication)
Activate the SUN feature by enabling Secure Dynamic Messaging (SDM)
Activates the mirroring of data (UID, read counter, secret file data and MAC) in a NDEF message on tapping.\n\nThis is working on Mifare DESFire EV3 tags only.
choose your action on SUN/SDM feature

Formatting the PICC will delete all applications and files on the PICC and releases all storage space back to factory settings.\n The settings of the Master Application are not reset so if you changed the default Master Application Key and key settings these changes will remain.
WARNING: The app will IMMEDIATELY FORMAT the PICC when attached without any further confirmation !\n\n You will loose any applications and files on the PICC without receovery !

Formatting the PICC will release all storage space back to factory settings.
 The settings of the Master Application are not reset so if you changed the default Master Application Key and/or key settings these changes will remain.

 The app will authenticate with the DEFAULT Master Application Key first to run the format PICC command.
